page.title: 01Landscape
page.content:
This block to the south-east of {Bedford }is dominated by the huge hangars at{Cardington}on the western boundary. These were the home of the ill-fated R101 but now house a newer version using modern technology.
The remainder of the area is mainly used for arable farming, although there is also some sheep.
There are two villages{Cardington {and Cople.}Cardington is still owned by the Whitbread Estate which gained its wealth from the brewing trade.In the graveyard is the memorial to the R101 victims.{Cardington}was the one time home of John Howard the 18th century prison reformer. It now has the office of the Bedfordshire Rural Community Council in the old school.
